hero.title: If they could speak, what would they say?
hero.subtitle: Raising awareness about animal exploitation through street activism and truth-based conversations

quoteSection.quote: Imagine being born into a world where your fate was already sealed. You were just a number — and your death, a scheduled event.

whoWeAre.title: Who we are
whoWeAre.description: We are a grassroots collective of animal rights activists. Since 2018, we've been educating the public with real footage from farms and slaughterhouses, showing the hidden cost of meat, dairy, eggs, leather, and more. In 2023, we formed Anonymous for the Unheard, a growing movement giving voice to the silenced and demanding justice for all animals.

whatWeBelieve.title: What we believe in
whatWeBelieve.description: We envision a world where animals are no longer treated as commodities, but as sentient beings worthy of respect, freedom, and peace. Through education and peaceful activism, we challenge norms and offer a better way forward for all living beings.

meat.title: Meat
meat.description: We see meat as food, not as someone's body. But every cut comes from a life that wanted to live — just like us.

fish.title: Fish
fish.description: Fish feel pain. They struggle, suffocate, and vanish by the billions — unseen, unheard.

eggs.title: Eggs
eggs.description: Eggs seem harmless. But behind every carton is a story of suffering, silenced chirps, and discarded lives.

dairy.title: Dairy
dairy.description: Most of us grew up believing dairy was normal, necessary, and natural. We were never shown the reality behind the glass of milk.

interlude.lineOne: Where did the love go? The love you once felt for all animals?
interlude.lineTwo: Who taught you to pet one and pay for another to be slaughtered?

factoryFarming.question: If factory farming is normal and humane, why does the industry go to such lengths to hide it?

cta.heading: IT STARTS WITH YOU
cta.description: Change doesn't begin in governments or big industries. It begins with a single person choosing to care — to act.
cta.invitation: Because every compassionate choice you make tells the world:
cta.line: Animals are not ours to use

meat.title: Meat
meat.subtitle: The Price of a Meal
meat.previewDescription: We see meat as food, not as someone's body. But every cut comes from a life that wanted to live — just like us.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
hiddenReality.start: Can you imagine watching others taken from you, one by one?
content: You hear screams. You smell blood. You see panic. You don't understand what's happening — but you know something is terribly wrong.
If you try to resist, you're beaten or shocked with an electric prod. You're pushed forward, step by step, toward the same fate.
This is the reality for animals used for meat — all of them. Not just pigs, cows, or sheep — all beings bred for slaughter face fear, violence, and death.
hiddenReality.end: Isn't it time to question that tradition?

left: Over 70 billion land animals are killed for meat each year
Many are just babies when they're slaughtered
"Humane slaughter" still ends in a terrified death
right: Pigs are as smart as dogs — and scream just as loudly
Animals often watch their companions die before them

animalSuffering.title: Animal Suffering
animalSuffering.text: Animals raised for meat live in overcrowded, unnatural conditions. They are mutilated without pain relief, denied medical care, and killed while still conscious — all for a meal that lasts minutes.

health.title: Health
health.text: High meat consumption is linked to heart disease, cancer, and antibiotic resistance. Most meat today comes from animals pumped with drugs and hormones, affecting our health in unseen ways.

environment.title: Environment
environment.text: Animal agriculture is a leading cause of deforestation, methane emissions, and water pollution. Forests are destroyed for animal feed, while millions of liters of water go into producing just one steak.

AnimalStories.title: Farm Animal Stories With Happy Endings

fish.title: Fish
fish.subtitle: The Silent Suffocation
fish.previewDescription: Fish feel pain. They struggle, suffocate, and vanish by the billions — unseen, unheard.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
hiddenReality.start: Can you imagine suffocating while fully conscious?
content: That's what trillions of fish endure every year.
Dragged from the ocean in massive nets, they're crushed, injured, and left to slowly suffocate on ship decks — still conscious, still feeling pain.
Others spend their short lives trapped in filthy, overcrowded fish farms, swimming in circles, infected and unseen.
hiddenReality.end: We never hear their screams. But that doesn't mean they don't suffer.

left: Fish feel pain, just like cats or dogs
More fish are killed each year than all other animals combined
Most are not stunned before death — they suffocate or are cut alive
right: Farmed fish live in filthy, crowded cages, filled with disease
Fish have individual personalities and can even recognize faces

animalSuffering.title: Animal Suffering
animalSuffering.text: Fish are sensitive, intelligent beings — yet their suffering is rarely acknowledged. They are crushed by nets, sliced open while conscious, or left to slowly suffocate. In fish farms, they endure isolation, disease, and neglect.

health.title: Health
health.text: Fish absorb the toxins of the waters they live in. From mercury and heavy metals to microplastics and parasites — these pollutants enter your body too when you consume fish or seafood.

environment.title: Environment
environment.text: Overfishing is destroying ocean ecosystems and pushing species to extinction. Massive trawlers tear up the ocean floor, while bycatch kills billions of non-target animals like turtles, dolphins, and seabirds.

AnimalStories.title: Farm Animal Stories With Happy Endings

eggs.title: Eggs
eggs.subtitle: The Cost of Eggs
eggs.previewDescription: Eggs seem harmless. But behind every carton is a story of suffering, silenced chirps, and discarded lives.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
hiddenReality.start: Can you imagine being born into a world where your worth is measured only by what you can produce?
content: For hens, life begins in darkness. If you're male, you're ground up or gassed on your first day — because you can't lay eggs.
If you're female, you're confined, mutilated, and pushed to your limit until your body gives out. Your beak is cut. Your wings never spread. Your song goes unheard.
hiddenReality.end: Behind every carton of eggs is a life reduced to a machine — until it breaks.

left: Male chicks are ground up alive on their first day of life
Even free-range hens often live in overcrowded sheds
Hens are genetically manipulated to lay far more eggs than is natural
right: Their bodies often break down from overproduction
Hens are killed when their egg production slows — long before old age

animalSuffering.title: Animal Suffering
animalSuffering.text: Egg-laying hens live confined in battery cages or crowded sheds, often unable to stretch their wings. Males are killed at birth, and females are pushed to the limit until their bodies give out.

health.title: Health
health.text: Eggs are high in cholesterol and may increase the risk of heart disease. They also carry risks of salmonella and other bacterial infections, especially in factory-farmed conditions.

environment.title: Environment
environment.text: Industrial egg farms contribute to ammonia pollution and waste runoff. The production of feed for hens consumes vast resources, while manure pollutes soil and waterways.

AnimalStories.title: Farm Animal Stories With Happy Endings

dairy.title: Dairy
dairy.subtitle: The Mother Behind the Milk
dairy.previewDescription: Most of us grew up believing dairy was normal, necessary, and natural. We were never shown the reality behind the glass of milk.

hiddenReality.title: The Hidden Reality
hiddenReality.start: Can you imagine having your baby taken from you, again and again, just so others can drink your milk?
content: In dairy, cows aren't just exploited — they're mothers robbed of motherhood.
They cry for days on end when their calves are taken. The milk meant for their babies is taken for humans.
Their bodies are pushed to extremes with constant cycles of forced pregnancy and loss.
hiddenReality.end: When they're no longer profitable, they're sent to slaughter — treated like nothing, after giving everything.

left: Cows only produce milk after giving birth, just like humans
Calves are taken away from their mothers within hours
Males are often killed for veal — a byproduct of dairy
right: Dairy cows are repeatedly impregnated to keep milk flowing
Most are slaughtered around age 5 — their natural lifespan is 20

animalSuffering.title: Animal Suffering
animalSuffering.text: Cows in the dairy industry endure repeated forced pregnancies and the trauma of losing their calves. Their bodies are pushed to unnatural limits and they are slaughtered

health.title: Health
health.text: Dairy consumption has been linked to acne, inflammation, and hormone disruption. Many adults are lactose intolerant, yet continue to consume dairy because of marketing, not necessity.

environment.title: Environment
environment.text: Dairy farms use enormous amounts of water and produce methane, a potent greenhouse gas. Waste from large-scale operations pollutes rivers and groundwater, harming ecosystems and communities.

AnimalStories.title: Farm Animal Stories With Happy Endings

callToAction.title: What You Can Do
callToAction.description: Every compassionate choice you make tells the world: Animals are not ours to use

choices.title: You Have A Choice
choices.subtitle: Because every compassionate choice you make tells the world

sections.title: Cube of Truth
sections.text: A peaceful street demonstration using real footage and open conversations to show what animal industries hide — and to imagine a different future.

sections.title: Street Activism
sections.text: We talk to passers-by with compassion, challenging norms and offering resources to support ethical choices like veganism.

whyThisExists.title: Why This Exists
whyThisExists.text1: Every day, billions of animals suffer in silence. We exist to disrupt that silence — through education, presence, and peaceful resistance.
whyThisExists.text2: We believe animals are not products, and their lives deserve more than convenience-based traditions.

team.title: Our Approach
team.text1-first: We don't shout. We don't shame.
team.text2: With truth, kindness, and empathy, we help people connect their values with their choices.

mask.text1: The mask represents solidarity — with the animals, with the truth, and with every fight against injustice. It redirects focus from the activist to the message:
